metadata.title: CVE-2023-1380 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A slab-out-of-bound read problem was found in brcmf_get_assoc_ies indrivers/net/wireless/broadcom/brcm80211/brcmfmac/cfg80211.c in the LinuxKernel. This issue could occur when assoc_info->req_len data is bigger thanthe size of the buffer, defined as WL_EXTRA_BUF_MAX, leading to a denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1380` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-212-generic - 4.15.0-212.223~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-212-generic - 4.15.0-212.223~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-212-lowlatency - 4.15.0-212.223~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1120-kvm - 4.4.0-1120.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1157-aws - 4.4.0-1157.172
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1157-aws - 4.15.0-1157.170~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-azure - 4.15.0-1166.181~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-gcp - 4.15.0-1151.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1120-oracle - 4.15.0-1120.131~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-212.223~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1120.130').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1157.172').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1157.170~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1166.181~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.167~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1120.131~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
